rules.rule: CONFLUENCE FRAMEWORK (Core DNA): Never enter trades on single reason. Require MINIMUM 3+ independent confluences before entry. Confluences = different data sources/methods that point to same outcome. Example: Technical divergence + breadth data + lead trader call + max pain + FOMC catalyst = high conviction entry.
rules.reason: Oct 28 SPXU trade demonstrates power of confluence: Pilot's bearish divergence (technical) + web research breadth weakness (market data) + Andy's AAPL/NVDA rejections (lead trader) + SPX resistance level (technical structure) + FOMC catalyst (macro) + Max pain lower (options) = 6 separate confluences = HIGH CONVICTION SETUP. Single-reason trades = 40% win rate. Multi-confluence trades will be tracked separately.
rules.source: 2025-10-28 Trade #6 - SPXU live analysis + Andy Intel integration

mechanics.step_1: Identify primary thesis (e.g., SPY reversion setup)
mechanics.step_2: Find 3+ independent confluences pointing to same outcome
mechanics.step_3: List each confluence with its source (technical, macro, data, lead trader, etc.)
mechanics.step_5: Document all confluences in trade record for post-trade analysis

confluence_types: Market data (breadth, relative strength, volatility, sentiment)
Lead trader calls (Andy levels, technical work, pattern recognition)
Options analysis (max pain, gamma exposure, implied volatility)
Own research and analysis (gap analysis, mean reversion setups)
rules.tracking: Will separate 1-reason trades vs 3+ confluence trades. Expected: 3+ confluence trades have 60%+ win rate vs 40% for single-reason trades.
rules.notes: This is NOT a rule to break. This is THE RULE. Every entry must have confluence scorecard. Prevents over-eager entries, validates setups, reduces false signals. Oct 28 example: 6 confluences = highest conviction in sample.

rules.rule: Direction filter: QQQ < 600.9 (and not reclaiming) OR rejection from 603.5 + lower high
rules.reason: Entered NVDA short without QQQ confirmation. Loss: -$100. Need directional filter to prevent counter-trend entries.

rules.rule: Location: Only short on rejection at range high (189.7–190.0) OR break–retest below 186.6
rules.reason: Entered NVDA inside range (186.6–189.9) with no edge. Loss: -$100. Require location confluence.

rules.rule: Volume confirmation: Entry bar ≥ 1.3× 20-bar average
rules.reason: Skipped volume checks on NVDA entry. Require 1.3x volume to confirm breakdowns/fades.

rules.rule: VIX re-entry flag: If VIX re-entry ON, only trade break–retests (no naked breakdowns)
rules.reason: VIX Bollinger Re-Entry triggered. Entering naked breakdowns in VIX-ON mode = squeeze risk.

rules.rule: Time: No new initiations in last 15 min of session unless already in profit
rules.reason: Prevents end-of-day desperation trades. Last 15 min should only be for exit management.

rules.rule: Stops: Pre-set 190.5 on rejection shorts; >VWAP reclaim on breakdown shorts
rules.reason: Prevent stop-hunting and emotional exits. Pre-set stops enforce discipline.

rules.rule: Short trigger: SPY close+retest < 659.5 AND QQQ < 600.9 AND ADD ≤ -500 AND 5-min 200 EMA down AND 1.3× volume
rules.reason: Entered SPY short without C+R confirmation. Loss: -$15. Need ALL confirmation criteria met.

rules.rule: Long trigger: SPY close+retest > 665.5 AND ADD ≥ +500 AND 5-min 200 EMA up AND 1.3× volume
rules.reason: Establish symmetric long trigger rules. Mirror the short structure for consistency.

rules.rule: Require C+R (close+retest) confirmation before fading resistance/support
rules.reason: Attempted fade without confirmation. Market rebounded instead of breaking down.

rules.rule: Only short when 5-min 200 EMA is falling (not flat or rising)
rules.reason: EMA flattened mid-trade, signaled failed breakdown. Require downtrend confirmation.

rules.rule: Do NOT fade improving breadth (ADD improving = risk-on signal)
rules.reason: ADD improved from -1300 to +50 during short entry. Fighting the tape.

rules.rule: Counter-trend trades (shorting when above 20 EMA) = half-size maximum
rules.reason: SPY above 20-day EMA = uptrend context. Shorts should be half-size or none.

rules.rule: Follow trigger stack cleanly: starter position, then adds on confirmation, then exit on signal
rules.reason: SPXU trade executed cleanly with adds and proper exit management. Document as best practice.

rules.rule: Track DXY divergence actively as USD strength signals risk-off
rules.reason: Executed cleanly but should have monitored DXY as additional risk signal.

rules.rule: Stay patient in choppy conditions. Respect chop structure. Avoid forcing trades in range chop.
rules.reason: ES chopped 6,650-6,700 with multiple rejections. Good discipline to only capture tactical SOLZ long.

rules.rule: Pre-plan response to repeated rejection zones. Don't chase breakouts that fail.
rules.reason: ES rejected 6,700 multiple times. System should have had pre-planned response.

rules.rule: Never enter on external tip without verifying against trigger checklist. External advice ≠ OUR thesis. All confluence criteria must be met REGARDLESS of advisor credibility.
rules.reason: Entered SPXU short based on Chris from Simpler Trading 9-day EMA recommendation. Loss: -$21. Skipped entire threat assessment because conviction in advisor was strong. Must verify OUR criteria even when external advice sounds good.
rules.source: 2025-10-27 Trade - SPXU short on external recommendation

Exit: 5-min close above thesis level = invalidation.

test_parameters.expected_edge: Reversion setups with gap extension + fib + max pain should win >50% over 10 trades
test_parameters.success_threshold: 50%+ win rate OR determine rule needs refinement

rules.rule: Divergence Confirmation Protocol: When bearish/bullish divergence spotted on 5-min, do NOT exit on first invalidation signal. Hold for 3 x 5-min candles to confirm divergence is real. Exit only if divergence fails to produce reversal over 3-candle window (15 minutes).
rules.reason: Oct 28 SPXU trade: Spotted bearish divergence (price higher, RSI lower, volume declining). Initial 5-min close above opening would have triggered mechanical exit. But divergence requires confirmation. Holding 3 candles allows price to prove/disprove divergence thesis before exiting.

mechanics.step_1: Spot divergence (price making higher high, but momentum/volume NOT confirming)
mechanics.step_3_success: If price rolls over within 3 candles (down close + RSI confirming + volume on downside) = divergence was right, thesis alive, HOLD
mechanics.step_3_failure: If price continues higher despite divergence (up close + RSI rising + weak volume) = divergence failed, thesis broken, EXIT

test_parameters.expected_edge: Divergence confirmation should improve win rate on reversion trades (reduce false exits)
test_parameters.success_metric: Divergence holds >70% of time over 3-candle window

rules.notes: NEW RULE - discovered live during Trade #6. This is flexibility + structure working together. Mechanical rule was right to question the setup, but divergence analysis adds nuance. Will track how often divergence confirms vs fails over time.

rules.rule: TWO-WAY FIBONACCI REVERSION FRAMEWORK (Core Systematic System): SELL at Fibonacci extensions (127%-168%) when bearish divergence + VWAP reversion signal appears. HOLD for 50%-61.8% pullback. BUY at pullback zone when it confluences with hard level (weekly high/low, monthly high/low, support/resistance). This creates repeatable two-direction system: Extensions = Sell zones, Pullbacks = Buy zones.
rules.reason: Oct 28 Trade #6 discovered complete systematic framework. Extended move to 127%-168% with bearish divergence is reliable SELL opportunity. Subsequent 50%-61.8% pullback to hard structure = reliable BUY opportunity. This transforms ad-hoc trading into repeatable methodology. Framework already produced +$20 on Trade #6 with clear thesis.

mechanics.sell_side: Entry at Fibonacci extension (127% or 168%) when: (1) Bearish divergence on 5-min (price higher, momentum lower), (2) VWAP yellow/orange/red arrow signal, (3) Tight stop at extension high, (4) Risk ≤ 1% account. Target: 50% pullback of extended move.
mechanics.buy_side: Entry at 50%-61.8% pullback zone when: (1) Pullback retraces to confluence point (weekly mid, monthly high, support level), (2) Technical setup valid at pullback level, (3) Volume/momentum confirming, (4) Risk defined. Target: Back to extension or beyond.
mechanics.confluence_requirement: Both SELL and BUY sides require 3+ confluences minimum (per Rule #0). Pullback buy MUST hit hard structure level (not arbitrary 50% - must be structure).

framework_structure.step_1: Identify extended move to 127% or 168% Fibonacci extension
framework_structure.step_2: Spot bearish divergence on 5-min timeframe (price higher, RSI/momentum lower)
framework_structure.step_3: Confirm VWAP yellow/orange/red arrow = price re-entering VWAP band
framework_structure.step_4: SELL with tight stop at extension high. Risk ≤ 1% of account. Run pre-entry checklist (Rule 0: 3+ confluences required).
framework_structure.step_5: Hold/manage for target = 50% pullback of extended move (e.g., if extended 688→686, target is 687)
framework_structure.step_6: When pullback begins, identify hard level confluence zone (weekly mid, monthly high, prior support)
framework_structure.step_7: BUY at confluence point IF (a) 50%-61.8% pullback present, (b) Technical setup valid, (c) 3+ confluences present
framework_structure.step_8: Repeat cycle as price continues trending or extends again

rules.example: Trade #6 SPXU: SPY extended to 688.5 (127% extension), bearish divergence 5-min, VWAP yellow arrow triggered. Entered short SPXU 13.68, stop 13.62 (tight). Target 50% pullback = 685-686 SPY. When pullback hits weekly support, set up next BUY. Framework = systematic, repeatable, risk-defined.
rules.expected_win_rate: Target 65%+ on each side when confluences present (vs 40% baseline single-reason). 50% pullback = natural profit-taking level where buyers emerge.

test_parameters.expected_edge: Two-way system should generate 2 opportunities per full cycle (1 sell, 1 buy). With 65% win rate + tight risk management = positive expectancy
test_parameters.sample_size_needed: 20 full cycles (40 total trades: 20 sells + 20 buys) to validate edge
test_parameters.success_threshold: 60%+ combined win rate on framework (either direction) over sample size

rules.notes: This is THE framework. Not a signal, not a filter - a complete systematic two-direction system. Extensions (bearish div + VWAP) = sell, pullbacks to hard structure = buy. Both require confluence. This is what happens when observation (50% mid-zone discovery) becomes systematic methodology. Trade #6 is living proof of framework validity.
